message: Today, we lay to rest a hero: Pennsylvania State Police Trooper Landon Weaver who was killed in the line of duty on December 30.   I send my deepest condolences to his wife, Macy, and all Trooper Weaver’s family and friends during this tragically difficult time.

Today is Opening Day at the Pennsylvania Farm Show. It is the largest indoor agriculture expo in the country and it runs through next Saturday.  This event has been widely attended for generations, and this year marks the 101st show! We hosted a public listening session with Members of Congress and state leaders so we could hear directly from our farmers how about agriculture policy impacts them.  House Agriculture Committee Mike Conaway Congressman Lou Barletta Congressman Tom Marino Mark Amodei Rep. Dan Newhouse Congressman Ted Yoho

Today we honor law enforcement officers throughout the country and thank them for the important work they do to keep us all safe. Our officers are mothers and fathers, sons and daughters, husbands and wives, and we are grateful for their service.  Blue lights are shining in windows throughout House offices today in honor of our officers and their families nationwide.  Thank you, to all those who answer the call to serve.  #thankacop #supportblue

I had a great meeting with a group of Juniata College students who are studying American politics. They're focusing on the timely topic of the Presidential Inauguration and our peaceful transition of power.  Thank you for visiting me at my Cannon House Office in Washington.

Tomorrow, my staff will host constituent hours in Franklin. Staff will be available to meet with residents who need assistance with federal agencies such as the Social Security Administration, the Department of Veterans Affairs, the IRS and others.     No appointments are necessary. Residents of Pennsylvania’s Fifth Congressional District are welcome to meet one-on-one with staff to discuss issues or concerns they may have with the federal government. Arriving early is encouraged, as meetings take place on a first-come, first-served basis.   Franklin Constituent Hours TIME: 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. DATE: Wednesday, January 25, 2017 PLACE: Franklin Area Chamber of Commerce 1327 Liberty Street, Franklin, PA 16323  Constituent hours take place at various locations throughout the district, but constituents can always reach my offices in Bellefonte or Titusville from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday.

It was an honor to again participate in the March for Life. So many joyful marchers come to our nation’s capital each year to stand up for life.   The March for Life is a joyous event where we hear stories of love, courage, and victory through God’s mercy and grace. All human life is sacred and we need to protect the most vulnerable. Thank you to all the Pennsylvanians who traveled to be here today.  We will continue to be a voice for the voiceless. #MarchforLife
This evening I shared some lighthearted words about Punxsutawney's most famous resident, Punxsutawney Phil! What do you think about his prediction of six more weeks of winter?
It was an honor to be in Erie today to speak about so many important issues that impact manufacturers in Pennsylvania.   Thank you to the Manufacturer & Business Association for hosting me.

Recently, I met with representatives from FCI McKean, and I'm pleased to support two bills that are important to FCI McKean employees.  H.R.  115, the Thin Blue Line Act,  would increase the penalty for someone who targets or attempts to kill a law enforcement officer, firefighter or any public safety officer. If passed, this bill will help deter individuals from targeting officers solely because of the uniform they wear.  I also proudly cosponsored H.R. 613, the Lieutenant Osvaldo Albarati Correctional Officer Self-Protection Act. This legislation honors the life of Lieutenant Albarati who was ambushed and murdered as a direct result of his work at a federal prison in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico. Additionally, it directs the Bureau Of Prisons to provide a secure storage area located outside the secure perimeter for correctional officers to store their personal firearms.   Our officers work to keep the public safe. We must ensure the same for them.

I am proud to have Andy Leung working as an intern in my Washington office. Andy joins us through the George Mason University LIFE Program for young adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities.  He quickly settled in as part of our office team, and we are very excited to have him on board. Pictured with us is Andy’s employment assistant Nishita Kotak.  Thanks, Andy! Keep up the great work.

Check out this story in Civil Eats about my bill to help our young farmers.   Farmers are stewards of the land and cornerstones of our rural communities. I look forward to passing this bill in the House. Investing in our nation’s ability to put food on the table for our neighbors is a bipartisan issue.  http://civileats.com/2017/03/06/want-to-revitalize-rural-america-forgive-student-loan-debt-for-young-farmers/

Thank you to the National Association of Manufacturers for honoring me with the NAM Award for Manufacturing Legislative Excellence at Owens-Illinois in Brockport.  Plant Manager Bob Martini presented me with the award during a recent visit to the facility.  I look forward to continuing to advance proposals that will strengthen the manufacturing sector and keep good-paying, family-sustaining jobs right here at home.

Thank you to the Penn State community for raising more than $10 million FTK at this year’s  Penn State THON .  Your commitment to helping pediatric cancer patients is inspiring. We are grateful for the emotional and financial support this great event provides to children, families, researchers and staff of the Four Diamonds Fund.

Happy National Agriculture Day! As Chairman of the House Agriculture Committee's Nutrition Subcommittee, I hosted a hearing on federal nutrition programs.   As the committee begins its work on the next farm bill, we will continue to identify ways to work alongside state and local organizations to help provide safe and nutritious food for those who need it most.   Thank you to all of our witnesses for your work to help ensure no one in America goes hungry. #AgDay

Great to meet with these future AIPAC – The American Israel Public Affairs Committee leaders during its annual policy conference in Washington, D.C.   Thank you to everyone who came in today to discuss strong, bipartisan support for Israel. #AIPAC2017
It was an honor to be at the PRLA Spring Conference this morning!

There was a great crowd at today's fifth annual Chesapeake Bay Day on Capitol Hill.   I was honored to speak as part of the Choose Clean Water briefing. Together, we can keep our waters clean and our ecosystems healthy.

I recently wrote an op-ed for the Centre Daily Times about the RECLAIM Act, which would help cleanup our abandoned coal mines.  Pennsylvania has more abandoned mines than any other state in the nation. The Fifth Congressional District has the most in the Commonwealth. I look forward to making this bill a reality.  http://www.centredaily.com/opinion/article144099434.html
Have a wonderful Easter.
The rain couldn't dampen an outing with the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service today in Spring Mills.   Thanks to everyone who joined today!

Today, I hosted a K-12 Education Policy Summit at Lock Haven University to discuss the ongoing implementation of the Every Student Succeeds Act, or ESSA.  Special thanks to Matt Stem, Pennsylvania's Deputy Secretary for Elementary and Secondary Education; Erin Duncan of the National Education Association; and Jacki Ball of the National Parent Teacher Association. It was a great event!
Attention high school art students: Submit your artwork for the Congressional Art Contest by next week! Good luck to all of our artists.

I had a great meeting last week at the Penn State Research Farm with high school and college students about the future of the agriculture industry.  The students asked great questions and I hope they all find successful careers in the industry.

My three sons are grown, but today I had the privilege of spending the day with Seth Parish for Take Your Daughters and Sons to Work Day.   Seth's Dad was in the U.S. Army and died in 2009. The nonprofit Tuesday's Children helped make today possible. Tuesday's Children uses its experience and expertise to help our military families work through their own losses.  Seth, who is 7, attended committee meetings, went to votes on the House floor, and we even had grilled cheese sandwiches for lunch at the Capitol. It has been an honor to spend today with Seth.

Take a look at CNN's report on Take Your Children To Work Day. There is some great coverage of Seth, our "pint-sized politician."  http://www.cnn.com/videos/tv/2017/04/28/take-your-kids-to-congress-day.cnn

Good Morning America featured an excellent story about a Penn State graduate, a veteran and a Mom in advance of Mother's Day this weekend.   Congratulations, Danielle, and thank you for sharing your inspiring story.   http://abcnews.go.com/Lifestyle/veteran-mother-shares-inspirational-story-back-school/story?id=47310023

It was a privilege to join the family of Pvt. David Kyle McCracken recently as a bridge in his hometown was dedicated in his memory. Pvt. McCracken was killed in action during World War II on Dec. 31, 1944.  Seventy-four years later, this bridge in Shawville, Pennsylvania bears his name. May we always remember Pvt. McCracken's sacrifice.

I had a great visit to DC Central Kitchen yesterday with Congressman Jim McGovern to see how DC Central Kitchen fights hunger in the nation's capital.   DC Central Kitchen knows that hunger is a symptom of a deeper problem: poverty. That's why it offers training and career opportunities to help address the challenges many individuals face. What an excellent organization!  Thank you to DC Central Kitchen for all you do to help so many in Washington, D.C.
This morning I welcomed students from Clearfield Area High School to Washington, D.C. on the steps of the U.S. Capitol.  What a great bunch of kids! Have a wonderful time in the nation's capital.

I had a great visit today to KCF Technologies in State College. The company has been growing rapidly since it was founded in November 2000, and it just hired its 50th employee!  Three researchers from Penn State formed  KCF Technologies. It develops and commercializes products and solutions for industry and the military.  Congratulations to Gary, Weicheng, and Jeremy on this milestone! It was an honor to visit today.

Proud to spend the day with Britni Burlingham of the The Bair Foundation of Pennsylvania as part of the National Foster Youth Institute's Shadow Day.  Britni entered the foster care system at age 7, and is now devoting her career to working with foster children. She said it has been life changing.  Thank you, Britni, for sharing your story and helping so many children overcome similar obstacles. We are all proud of your success! #Fosteryouthvoices
Today we pause to honor the fallen and remember those who gave all in service to this nation.   May God bless them and God bless the United States of America.

"The eyes of the world are upon you." -- General Dwight D. Eisenhower  We honor the service of so many from the Greatest Generation who landed on this day 73 years ago on the beaches of Normandy, France.  Let us always remember those brave Americans who defended our freedom. #DDay

On Wednesday, I hosted Penn State's President, Dr. Barron, to brief Pennsylvania's Congressional Delegation on Invent Penn State (Invent Penn State Venture & IP Conference) the university's effort to tap into the entrepreneurial spirit of students and faculty to create start-ups and enrich their communities.   Thanks to Reps. Congressman Charlie Dent, Rep. Dwight Evans, Congressman Brian Fitzpatrick, and Congressman Keith Rothfus for their interest in PSU's efforts.

I was at a speaking engagement early this morning when the shooting took place at the congressional baseball practice. My wife, Penny, and I are praying for a quick recovery for Majority Whip Scalise and all those who were injured in this horrific incident.   I want to thank the Capitol Police and the local law enforcement officials for their quick response and handling of the situation. Out of an abundance of caution, there is an increased police presence in and around the Capitol and office buildings, which remain open to the public and lawmakers.   We certainly owe the Capitol Police a debt of gratitude for how they selflessly place themselves in harm’s way to protect the public day in and day out.

I recently met with members of the United Spinal Association, including Megan Lee and Christian Budney from Scranton, PA as well as Ken Ryno from Kunkletown, PA .   These dedicated individuals advocate on behalf of those living with spinal cord injuries and disorders, and help provide information to their families, care givers, and health care professionals. I greatly appreciate their service to the community.

This morning I spoke about the importance of passing the Strengthening Career and Technical Education for the 21st Century Act, which will be voted on tomorrow in the House.  We have heard the voices of those struggling to find the opportunities they need. This bill will help people from all walks of life succeed and find good-paying, family-sustaining carrers. #WhyCTE
Happy Independence Day! Wishing everyone a happy and safe Fourth of July.

Today I spoke on the House floor recognizing five students from Pennsylvania's Fifth District who were chosen as delegates to represent Pennsylvania at the Congress of Future Medical Leaders in Lowell, MA. Congratulations to: Donovan Brubaker, Catherine McQuitty, Hannah Mull, Mackenzie Wilcox, and Sarah Zakrzwski on their outstanding accomplishment!

Today I had the pleasure of hosting Pennsylvania Farm Bureau’s President, Rick Ebert, while he briefed members of the PA delegation and staff on key issues for PA farmers, with a focus on the Farm Bill. Additionally, Pennsylvania’s Secretary of Agriculture, Russell Redding, was able to join the briefing and offer his insight on the current state and future of agriculture in PA.    Thank you again to the Pennsylvania Farm Bureau, Secretary Redding and my colleagues for participating in an important conversation about our state’s #1 economic driver...Agriculture!

Today I had the pleasure of welcoming Cassy Lester, this year’s winner of the Congressional Art Competition from the Fifth District of Pennsylvania, and her family to the Capitol. After an afternoon luncheon held for the first place winners from around the country, I was able to show Cassy and her parents around the Capitol. We made sure to stop by her painting “Chocolate Lab” that will hang in the tunnel to the Capitol for the next year. Congratulations Cassy! It was great to have you here today.

I recently toured Thaddeus Stevens College of Technology with my colleague Congressman Lloyd Smucker. It is Pennsylvania's only state-owned, two-year technical college and a premiere school for career and technical education.

Yesterday's announcement that GE  plans to cut 575 jobs is incredibly disappointing, and I am concerned about those employees who have dedicated their careers to providing quality craftsmanship for GE.   As a community, we must support those whose lives may be upended by this decision and provide all the resources possible to assist them moving forward. I am frustrated that, yet again, the value of our workforce in Erie County is not being recognized.    http://www.erienewsnow.com/clip/13533917/rep-glenn-thompson-on-ge

I discussed why strengthening Career and Technical Education is a no-brainer in the August issue of Electroindustry Magazine. The House passed my bipartisan bill unanimously because CTE opens the door for more Americans to achieve success in today’s workforce.    Check out the full article here: www.nema.org/ei-august2017

This week is National Farmers Market Week! As the Chairman of the Nutrition Subcommittee, I know our farmers provide healthy, local foods for families and communities across the country.   Check out the @USDA’s Local Food Directory to find a farmers market near you: https://www.ams.usda.gov/local-food-directories/farmersmarkets
It was excellent to tour the Rosebud Coal Company in Clearfield County yesterday with faculty members from Penn State’s Mining Program.  Thank you for hosting us for a truly informative visit.
It was great listen to the input and expertise of Mike Wolf of Appalachian Forest Consultants while touring Lock Haven’s watershed lands.  Thank you for having me.
Thank you to Solvay and Marcus Branstad, State Affairs Director of the American Chemistry Council, for speaking with me about their work and involvement in the natural gas industry.
Thank you to Mairfab INC and President Michael Gates for showing me the quality work they do for the energy industry of Pennsylvania. I look forward to seeing your progress as the company grows.

Thank you to WPSU for hosting me last night for a #WPSUTownHall, and thank you to the studio audience and those watching and listening at home.  I am glad that we were able to reach so many throughout the Fifth Congressional District as it was aired on TV, radio and streamed online. WQLN Public Media will rebroadcast the event on Sunday night from 5:30 to 6:30 p.m. in the Erie market.  Thanks to all who participated and especially the talented staff at WPSU Penn State for an excellent production.

Today, I presented two outstanding students from Pennsylvania’s 5th District with The Congressional Award Medals for their dedication to their communities.   Congrats to William Huang on his Silver Medal and Sarah Yarger on her Bronze Medal.   Read more about their achievements here: https://thompson.house.gov/press-release/thompson-recognizes-two-pennsylvania-students-congressional-awards-service

Thank you to the members of PSEA - PA State Education Associationfor meeting with me this week. I appreciated the discussion and update on your grassroots advocacy programs.  It was great to see Jennifer Statler, Rudy Burruss, Tracey Hart, Todd Russell, and Amy Lawrence in Bellefonte.
Thank you for meeting with me as Chairman of the Nutrition Subcommittee, I will continue to work hard to ensure SNAP remains a viable program for generations to come.

Great story about my friend and colleague Congressman Jim Langevin. Together, we chair the Career and Technical Education Caucus.   Jim is an inspiration to many, and I am proud to count him as a friend. I look forward to continuing our work together.  http://wpri.com/2017/08/21/congressman-jim-langevin-breaks-barriers-on-capitol-hill/

Congratulations to Senator Jake Corman for being named the 2017 Friend of the Fair at the Centre County Grange Fair!  The Grange Fair started in 1874 and takes place annually. It is a wonderful end of summer tradition. This family event has something for everyone -- livestock exhibitions and sales, carnival rides, camping, concession stands and more! It runs through Saturday, August 26.
TBT to last week at  Penn State's Ag Progress Days. I had a great time meeting with Pennsylvania's farmers and speaking with my colleagues about the state of agriculture in America.
Had an excellent visit to the Baums Lab recently. Thank you for hosting me!

It was an honor to be at Central Pennsylvania Institute of Science and Technology earlier this week with my colleague Raja Krishnamoorthi - Congressman, IL-8 to call on the U.S. Senate to make career and technical education -- CTE -- a priority this fall.  CPI is home to more than 18 secondary programs, over 60 in-house adult & continuing education programs. It just announced a new Natural Gas Compression program that begins this November and is one of only two programs of its kind nationwide. CTE programs are a pathway to success for all Americans.  Thanks to CPI, all of our speakers and especially Rep. Krishnamoorthi for traveling from Illinois to see the great work CPI does in Central PA. #WhyCTE #LearntoEarn

It was a pleasure meeting with American Cancer Society Board Member and brave survivor, Daniel Heist, in my Washington, D.C. office this afternoon.   We must continue to work together, every day, to find a cure for this devastating disease. #CancerLobbyDay

Today is National POW/MIA Recognition Day, and a day we remember our heroes who never returned home.    We must never forget the unthinkable pain for families whose loved ones are still missing. Currently, more than 83,000 American service members are unaccounted-for From World War II, the Korean War, Vietnam and the Global War on Terror.   That’s why I’ve introduced the “Keeping Our Promise to MIA/POWs” resolution in the House of Representatives. H. Con. Res. 61 expresses the sense of Congress that any nation seeking to potentially enter into a mutually beneficial trade agreement with the United States should provide reasonable access and partnership with the United States for the purposes of research and recovery of our unaccounted service members. #YouAreNotForgotten #POWMIARecognitionDay

I was proud to join the Warriors to Washington from Erie County Sunday morning at Arlington National Cemetery to lay a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknowns.  Thank you, Erie County Veterans, for traveling to Arlington to participate in this solemn ceremony. May we never forget those who died in service to this nation.

This morning, I met with Paige Bryan who is a senior student studying health occupations at Clearfield County Career and Technology Center. She plans to pursue a Ph.D. in forensic science.  Listen to Paige speak about why Career and Technical Education is a pathway to success. Thank you, Paige, for sharing your #WhyCTE story with us.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tNPNMkbd8XU

Yesterday, I was in Clearfield to update the public on the Pine Grove waterline project.   It will serve 148 homes and businesses who currently have wells and water supplies that are impacted or degraded due to former surface or underground coal mining operations.   Check out WTAJ's report on the event.

Today with Congressman Joe Courtney, I introduced the School Milk Nutrition Act of 2017, which seeks to reverse the decline of milk consumption in schools.  By allowing children more milk options - including flavored milk - it is my hope that we will witness milk consumption return to historic levels.

On Thursday, I welcomed Pastor Kenneth Codner to the Capitol to serve as guest chaplain for the day. He offered the opening prayer and his family proudly watched from the House Gallery.  Pastor Codner serves at Grace Baptist Church in Spring Mills, Pa., and it was an honor to have him in Washington.  https://thompson.house.gov/press-release/spring-mills-pastor-serves-guest-chaplain-us-house-representatives

Yesterday, the House unanimously approved my bill with Congresswoman Julia Brownley to allow VA doctors to practice telemedicine across state lines.  This means our veterans can receive the best care possible regardless of where they live. It is especially important for those in rural areas who would otherwise not have access to services.  Thank you to all who supported this bill. It is my hope that the Senate takes it up quickly.  https://thompson.house.gov/press-release/house-approves-vets-act-expands-access-telemedicine-va-system

As we prepare to celebrate Veterans Day Saturday, it was an honor to have breakfast with some veterans this morning at the Armed Forces Retirement Home in Washington, D.C.   The retirement home fulfills our nation’s commitment to our veterans by providing a community with exceptional residential care and extensive support services. It has residents who served in every branch of the military living there. It was a wonderful visit.
Happy Veterans Day to all of our servicemen and women. On behalf of a grateful nation, thank you for answering the country's call for service. #VeteransDay2017

Today, the family of 1st Lt. David Gephart Myers presented a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknowns in Arlington National Cemetery. It is the same wreath that was placed during the Opening Ceremony for the Vietnam Memorial Traveling Wall in Centre County.  1st Lt. Myers was a pilot with the U.S. Marine Corps and a member of the Marine Observation Squadron 3. On June 8, 1967, he was flying in a Bell Iroquois Utility Helicopter in South Vietnam when his aircraft was hit by small arms fire and crashed. His remains were not recovered.  His loving family, especially his brother, Gary Myers, continue to keep his memory alive. 1st Lt. Myers lives on in their hearts and in the heart of a grateful nation.

As we gather today with family and friends to recognize and celebrate all we are thankful for, let us remember the men and women in the Armed Forces who are not able to be with their own families. God bless our servicemen and women who keep us safe.  From my family to yours, Happy Thanksgiving.

It's Small Business Saturday - a day to support your local mom and pop shops. Small businesses are the backbone of the American economy, and nearly 7 out of every 10 new jobs come from a small business.  What's your favorite small business in your town? #SmallBizSaturday

I am proud to congratulate CPI Horticulture and Landscaping Instructor Joe Luther for being named CTE Teacher of the Year.  Joe will receive the Carl J. Schaefer Memorial Award that annually recognizes career technical education teachers for their outstanding service during a ceremony later this week.   Congratulations, Joe! We are most proud of your outstanding achievement.

Congratulations to Linda and Steve Weaver, owners of Mount Nittany Vineyard & Winery for winning a Best of Category at this year's Atlantic Seaboard Wine Association competition for its 2016 Geisenheim wine. In total, they took home 1 Gold, 6 Silver and 2 Bronze awards!  Linda and Steve were in Washington yesterday for the awards ceremony. I wish them the best as they continue to grow, make and produce their fine wines in Centre County.
